sen.j: 賀茂光栄（かも の みつよし、天慶2年（939年） - 長和4年6月7日 (旧暦)（1015年6月25日））は、平安時代の陰陽師、陰陽家。
sen.e: KAMO no Mitsuyoshi (939 - June 25, 1015) was Onmyoji/Inyoka (Master of Yin yang) who lived in the Heian period.

sen.j: 賀茂保憲の長男、賀茂忠行は祖父にあたる。
sen.e: He was the oldest son of KAMO no Yasunori, and had KAMO no Tadayuki as his grandfather.

sen.j: 祖父・父に同じく抜群の腕を持つ陰陽師であったという。
sen.e: He is said to have had remarkable skills as Onmyoji like his father and grandfather.

sen.j: 父・保憲は後に家学であった陰陽道のうち暦道を光栄に、天文道を愛弟子（もしくは弟弟子）の安倍晴明に譲り、ここに陰陽道の二大宗家「安賀両家」が成立する。
sen.e: His father, Yasunori, later passed on the Rekido (the study of the calendar) of the Onmyodo (way of Ying and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), which was the teaching of the family, to Mitsuyoshi, and the Tenmondo (ancient horoscopy) to his favorite disciple (or junior disciple), ABE no Seimei, and thus the two main Soke (the head family or house) of Onmyodo, "Angaryo family" (Abe family and Kamo family) were established.

sen.j: 光栄はなぜ賀茂氏の家学である陰陽道を分割してまで安倍氏に宗家の地位を与えたのか疑問に思っていたらしく、晴明と争論したという（「続古事談」）。
sen.e: It seems that Mitsuyoshi, wondering why his father went so far as to divide the Onmyodo, which was the teaching of the KAMO family, in order to give the position of Soke to the Abe clan; as such, it is said that Mitsuyoshi argued with Seimei over this matter ("Zoku kojidan" (Talks of the Past, Continued)).

sen.j: 暦博士・天文博士・大炊頭・主計頭などを歴任、一説には陰陽允を歴任したというが可能性は低い。
sen.e: He successively held posts such as Reki hakase (master of reki (calendar)), Tenmon hakase (master of tenmon (astronomy)), and Kazue no kami (the head of budget bureau), and one theory has it that he successively held the post of Onmyo no jo (secretary of Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination)) although this is unlikely.
